abstract: Resolves the user account that’s the source of the funds.

declaration.code: optional func resolveFromAccount(for intent: INTransferMoneyIntent, with completion: @escaping (INPaymentAccountResolutionResult) -> Void)

overview:
## Discussion

Implement this method to resolve the account that’s the source of the transferred funds. Use this method to verify that the specified account exists and you can use it as the source of a funds transfer. The [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INTransferMoneyIntent/fromAccount] property of the intent object contains any information provided by the user about which account to use. Don’t try to verify that the account has sufficient funds for the transfer. Instead, verify that the account has sufficient funds in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INTransferMoneyIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] method.

Return a successful resolution if you’re able to verify the existence of the account. If the user doesn’t have any accounts to facilitate a transfer, return a successful resolution or indicate that the account isn’t required and then use the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INTransferMoneyIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] method to report an appropriate error. If the user has multiple accounts that match the provided information, either pick one and ask for confirmation or use the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPaymentAmountResolutionResult/disambiguation(with:)] method to create a resolution that prompts the user to select an account.

# resolveFromAccount(for:with:)

**Instance Method**

Resolves the user account that’s the source of the funds.

## Declaration

```swift
optional func resolveFromAccount(for intent: INTransferMoneyIntent, with completion: @escaping (INPaymentAccountResolutionResult) -> Void)
```

```swift
optional func resolveFromAccount(for intent: INTransferMoneyIntent) async -> INPaymentAccountResolutionResult
```

## Parameters

- **intent**: The intent object containing details of the user’s request. Use this object to get the initial information, if any, provided by the user.
- **completion**: The handler block to execute with the resolution. You must execute this handler at some point during your implementation of this method. This handler has no return value and takes the following parameter:



## Discussion

Implement this method to resolve the account that’s the source of the transferred funds. Use this method to verify that the specified account exists and you can use it as the source of a funds transfer. The [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INTransferMoneyIntent/fromAccount] property of the intent object contains any information provided by the user about which account to use. Don’t try to verify that the account has sufficient funds for the transfer. Instead, verify that the account has sufficient funds in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INTransferMoneyIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] method.

Return a successful resolution if you’re able to verify the existence of the account. If the user doesn’t have any accounts to facilitate a transfer, return a successful resolution or indicate that the account isn’t required and then use the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INTransferMoneyIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] method to report an appropriate error. If the user has multiple accounts that match the provided information, either pick one and ask for confirmation or use the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INPaymentAmountResolutionResult/disambiguation(with:)] method to create a resolution that prompts the user to select an account.

## Resolving the Intent Parameters

- **resolveToAccount(for:with:)**: Resolves the user account that’s the destination of the funds.
- **resolveTransactionAmount(for:with:)**: Resolves the amount that the user wants to transfer.
- **resolveTransactionScheduledDate(for:with:)**: Resolves the date on which the transfer is to occur.
- **resolveTransactionNote(for:with:)**: Resolves any custom notes associated with the transaction.
